result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs due by payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning 7/15/16. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08.
Submit to DNA sample on report date/time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon C Hardy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon C Hardy in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. State gives joint recommendation. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brandon C Hardy in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests adjornment for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Further proceedings on April 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Hardy in court with attorney Michael F Torphy.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court provides copy of complaint. Counsel enters not guilty plea.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
w/condition:  no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.

Defendant Brandon C Hardy in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of penalties.  Defendant indicates did not receive a copy of the complaint.  Defendant indicates serving a huber sentence in Waukesha until March 19.  Copy of complaint provided to defendant.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant indicates will not be retaining counsel.  Court examines defendant further on counsel.  Defendant requesting to contact the public defender.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Voice message from defendant stating he currently has huber release from  Waukesha County Jail. If unable to appear 1/6/16 he will fax a letter requesting an adjournment. Clerk provided fax number.
